meanings.definition: To come off in thin, flat pieces.
meanings.sent1: The paint on the old wall was flaking away.
meanings.sent2: The dry skin on my heels was flaking off after using lotion.
meanings.sent3: As the pastry chef tried to flip the pancake, it kept flaking apart.
meanings.sent4: Her confidence was flaking like old paint, revealing her insecurities.
meanings.sent5: The ancient book's pages were flaking, revealing the delicate parchment underneath.

meanings.sent1: The bark of the tree was flaking off in the hot sun.
meanings.sent2: After sunburn, my skin started flaking and peeling.
meanings.sent3: The flaking paint on the fence made it look like a colorful zebra.
meanings.sent4: His flaking resolve crumbled like a cookie, unable to withstand the pressure.
meanings.sent5: The old wallpaper was flaking off the walls, revealing layers of history underneath.

meanings.definition: To break or fall off in flakes.
meanings.sent1: The rust on the metal gate was flaking off due to exposure to the elements.
meanings.sent2: The ancient statue's nose was flaking off, showing its age.
meanings.sent3: The flaking ice on the pond made it look like a giant snow cone.
meanings.sent4: His flaking excuses were like a crumbling wall, unable to hold up under scrutiny.
meanings.sent5: The old paint on the house was flaking away, revealing the weathered wood underneath.
